<<<api>>>: SortedMap.firstKey
<<<code>>>:  SortedMap<Object, Object> sortedProperties = new TreeMap<>(prop);
sortedProperties.put("1_aaa", "bla");
sortedProperties.put("10_jjj", "bla");
System.out.println(sortedProperties.firstKey());
<<<explanation>>>: To sort the map by the given string with a numeric prefix, you can use the `TreeMap` constructor that takes a `Comparator` object. The `Comparator` object can be created using the `String.valueOf()` method to convert the string key to an integer value, and then use the `Comparator.comparingInt()` method to compare the integer values. In this case, you can use `Comparator.comparingInt(String::valueOf).reversed()` to sort the map in descending order.
```
SortedMap<Object, Object> sortedProperties = new TreeMap<>(comparator);
sortedProperties.put("1_aaa", "bla");
sortedProperties.put("10_jjj", "bla");
System.out.println(sortedProperties.firstKey());
```
You can also use `SortedMap.firstKey()` method to get the first key of the sorted map.
